00002 
00013 #define __GETOPT_H__
00014 
00015 /* All the headers include this file. */
00016 #include <crtdefs.h>
00017 
00018 #ifdef __cplusplus
00019 extern "C" {
00020 #endif
00021 
00022 extern int optind;              /* index of first non-option in argv      */
00023 extern int optopt;              /* single option character, as parsed     */
00024 extern int opterr;              /* flag to enable built-in diagnostics... */
00025                                 /* (user may set to zero, to suppress)    */
00026 
00027 extern char *optarg;            /* pointer to argument of current option  */
00028 
00029 extern int getopt(int nargc, char * const *nargv, const char *options);
00030 
00031 #ifdef _BSD_SOURCE
00032 /*
00033  * BSD adds the non-standard `optreset' feature, for reinitialisation
00034  * of `getopt' parsing.  We support this feature, for applications which
00035  * proclaim their BSD heritage, before including this header; however,
00036  * to maintain portability, developers are advised to avoid it.
00037  */
00038 # define optreset  __mingw_optreset
00039 extern int optreset;
00040 #endif
00041 #ifdef __cplusplus
00042 }
00043 #endif
00044 /*
00045  * POSIX requires the `getopt' API to be specified in `unistd.h';
00046  * thus, `unistd.h' includes this header.  However, we do not want
00047  * to expose the `getopt_long' or `getopt_long_only' APIs, when
00048  * included in this manner.  Thus, close the standard __GETOPT_H__
00049  * declarations block, and open an additional __GETOPT_LONG_H__
00050  * specific block, only when *not* __UNISTD_H_SOURCED__, in which
00051  * to declare the extended API.
00052  */
00053 #endif /* !defined(__GETOPT_H__) */
00054 
00055 #if !defined(__UNISTD_H_SOURCED__) && !defined(__GETOPT_LONG_H__)
00056 #define __GETOPT_LONG_H__
00057 
00058 #ifdef __cplusplus
00059 extern "C" {
00060 #endif
00061 
00062 struct option           /* specification for a long form option...      */
00063 {
00064   const char *name;             /* option name, without leading hyphens */
00065   int         has_arg;          /* does it take an argument?            */
00066   int        *flag;             /* where to save its status, or NULL    */
00067   int         val;              /* its associated status value          */
00068 };
00069 
00070 enum                    /* permitted values for its `has_arg' field...  */
00071 {
00072   no_argument = 0,              /* option never takes an argument       */
00073   required_argument,            /* option always requires an argument   */
00074   optional_argument             /* option may take an argument          */
00075 };
00076 
00077 extern int getopt_long(int nargc, char * const *nargv, const char *options,
00078     const struct option *long_options, int *idx);
00079 extern int getopt_long_only(int nargc, char * const *nargv, const char *options,
00080     const struct option *long_options, int *idx);
00081 /*
00082  * Previous MinGW implementation had...
00083  */
00084 #ifndef HAVE_DECL_GETOPT
00085 /*
00086  * ...for the long form API only; keep this for compatibility.
00087  */
00088 # define HAVE_DECL_GETOPT       1
00089 #endif
00090 
00091 #ifdef __cplusplus
00092 }
00093 #endif
00094 
00095 #endif /* !defined(__UNISTD_H_SOURCED__) && !defined(__GETOPT_LONG_H__) */
